problems.title: 0/1 Knapsack Problem
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You are given N items, each with a weight and a value.
You have a knapsack with capacity W.

Each item can either be taken completely or not taken at all (0/1 choice).
Find the maximum value you can put in the knapsack.

This is the classic 0/1 Knapsack problem!

DP State: dp[i][w] = max value using first i items with capacity w.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
3 50
60 10
100 20
120 30

Sample Output
220

Explanation:
Items (value, weight): [(60,10), (100,20), (120,30)]
Capacity = 50

Take item 2 (value=100, weight=20) and item 3 (value=120, weight=30).
Total weight = 50, Total value = 220.

class Solution:

        # dp[i][w] = max value with first i items and capacity w
        pass

if __name__ == '__main__':
    import sys
    data = sys.stdin.read().strip().split('\n')
    n, capacity = map(int, data[0].split())
    items = []
    for i in range(1, n + 1):
        v, w = map(int, data[i].split())
        items.append((v, w))
    sol = Solution()
    print(sol.knapsack(items, capacity))

hintsList: For each item, choose to include it (if weight allows) or exclude it. dp[i][w] = max(dp[i-1][w], dp[i-1][w-wt[i]] + val[i]).
Can optimize to 1D: iterate w from capacity down to wt[i]. dp[w] = max(dp[w], dp[w-wt[i]] + val[i]).
